something about king ape (as apes are called
"Rau"'s when google translate is on) Another thing
I noticed is that in japan, most rares can come
from multiple CD's.Someone that knows more
japanese should look over this site.

By Lisa Shock on Monday, January 7, 2013 - 10:05 pm:

Yeah, in some cases, rares were hard coded to come from several sources. This was done more in MR3 in the US. That said, any CD that has the same subcode as a rare disc will make that rare, thus the oddball PC discs that make some MR2 rares.

By Wau! That's A Low Price! on Thursday, January 10, 2013 - 06:35 pm:

Yes I understand that. One thing to note is that the
different subcodes for the rares had different
stats. Another thing that i saw is that one of the
CD's that makes pole mock in the japanese version
is, and you won't belive this, ELECTRIC WARRIOR T
REX

By qolf on Saturday, March 16, 2013 - 10:00 pm:

I think it's really interesting how the Japanese
version has some different monsters than the U.S.
The secret golem was probably changed to Forward
Golem due to the alcohol reference maybe.Same goes
to the Kato's picture with all the sake or whatever
in the background(even though its still viewable at
the Errantry wanted list).I wonder why the others
like the secreat Wracky and Kato were changed.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, March 17, 2013 - 12:16 am:

No, the JP Pole Mock didn't come from Electric Warrior. That CD wasn't released in Japan. The North American rares were decided upon, then an employee was sent to buy the discs to make the rares. I personally know the person who purchased the CDs. Anyway, here's info on the JP version: Pole Mock

one of the CD's that makes pole mock is Electric
Warrior T rex. Don't belive me? check the website
that I linked to.
